intro: Damburneya roberto-andinoi, commonly known as the Andinoi damburneya, is a rare and striking plant native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the Arecaceae family, commonly known as the palm family, and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by distinctive, elongated fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its native environment.
